{
    "number": 66498,
    "data": "7,9,13,14,18,19,21,26,27,28,31,35,36,37,38,39,42,43,45,49,52,54,56,57,61,62,63,65,67,70,72,73,74,76,77,78,79,81,84,86,90,91,93,95,97,98,99,103,104,105,108,109,111,112,114,117,119,122,124,126,127,129,130,133",
    "name": "Numbers n such that 3 divides phi(n).",
    "comment": [
        "Numbers n such that x^3 == 1 mod(n) has solutions 1<x<n.",
        "a(n) are the numbers generated by 3^2=9 and all primes >3 congruent to (0, 1) mod 3. Hence sequence gives values of k such k==0 mod(9) and k==0 mod(p) when p==1 mod(3).",
        "Terms are multiple of 9 or of a prime of the form 6k+1."
    ],
    "link": [
        "Harry J. Smith, <a href=\"/A066498/b066498.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000</a>"
    ],
    "example": [
        "If n < 7 then x^3 = 1 mod(n) has no solution 1<x<n, but (2,4) are solutions of x^3 = 1 mod(7), hence a(1)=7."
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "Select[Range[150], Divisible[EulerPhi[#], 3]&] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jan 12 2011 *)"
    ],
    "program": [
        "(PARI) { n=0; for (m=1, 10^10, if (eulerphi(m)%3 == 0, write(\"b066498.txt\", n++, \" \", m); if (n==1000, return)) ) } \\\\ _Harry J. Smith_, Feb 18 2010"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A000010, A066499, A066500, A066501, A066502.",
        "A007645(n) gives the primes congruent to 1 mod(3).",
        "Column k=2 of A277915."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn",
    "offset": "1,1",
    "author": "_Benoit Cloitre_, Jan 04 2002",
    "ext": [
        "Simpler definition from Yuval Dekel (dekelyuval(AT)hotmail.com), Oct 25 2003",
        "Corrected and extended by _Ray Chandler_, Nov 05 2003"
    ],
    "references": 11,
    "revision": 34,
    "time": "2016-11-05T15:41:51-04:00",
    "created": "2003-05-16T03:00:00-04:00"
}
